stats.distributions module¶

stats.distributions.poisson_logpdf(k, l)[source]¶

Gives the log-pdf for a poisson distribution with rate l evaluated at points k. k should be a vector of integers.

stats.distributions.poisson_pdf(k, l)[source]¶
stats.distributions.gaussian_logpdf(mu, sigma, x)[source]¶

Non-positive standar deviations will be clipped

stats.distributions.gaussian_pdf(mu, sigma, x)[source]¶
stats.distributions.explogpdf(x, dx=1)[source]¶

Convert log-pdf to normalized pdf, integrating to get normalization constant

stats.distributions.sample_categorical(pobabilities)[source]¶

Pick a state according to probabilities

Parameters

probabilities (vector) – Vector of probabilities, must sum to 1.

Returns

i – integer between 0 and len(probabilities)-1

Return type

int
